The incomplete transformation of Syria's Ahmad al-Sharaa, Islamist rebel turned president
subhead: 'Syria after al-Assad' (1/5). The man who toppled Syria's Baathist regime has succeeded in breaking the country's international isolation. Yet the former jihadist, who governs with a handful of loyal followers, has struggled to defuse the sectarian and ethnic tensions left by the civil war.

subhead: MP Jean-Philippe Tanguy, who is preparing a bill to create cooperative venues managed by sex workers themselves, says penalizing customers has worsened the situation of sex workers.

title: Trump unveils $12 billion in aid for farmers rocked by tariffs: 'We love our farmers'
subhead: The US president has repeatedly blamed former president Joe Biden for the problems faced by American farmers. But the situation has echoes of Trump's first presidency, when retaliatory tariffs caused over $27 billion in US agriculture export losses from 2018 to 2019.

title: Closure of Madrid's Café Central signals a city in transition
subhead: The iconic Madrid jazz venue is set to close its doors in early 2026. The decision has sparked a strong reaction as the Spanish capital faces rapid gentrification.

title: Cocaine overtakes cannabis as France's most sold drug
subhead: With a value of €3.1 billion compared to €2.7 billion for cannabis, cocaine has become the leading illicit drug market in France, according to a French drugs observatory study.

subhead: Famed worldwide for his saturated images capturing leisure society, the British photographer died of cancer on Saturday at the age of 73.

title: France's budget, a crucial task in mostly male hands
subhead: The two finance committees are the most male-dominated in the entire French Parliament. Neither has ever been chaired by a woman.

title: 100 years of the photobooth: Meet the people keeping them alive
subhead: Created in New York in 1925, the analog photobooth has come close to extinction over the years. Two passionate restorers, Eddy Bourgeois and Virginie Voisneau, are helping keep the vintage booth alive in France and beyond.
